item.description:
GREEN MOUNTAIN SERIES: Early Fall Colors... over Mt. Mansfield, Vermont's Highest Peak! (cross-post with Hiking Mates CHALLENGE)


PLEASE -- TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW. By signing up you have agreed to our [url=http://www.meetup.com/Hiking-Mates-CHALLENGE/about/]GROUP GUIDELINES.!


EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 281-5882.


UPDATES (08/23/2009 10:00 AM):

THIS IS A WEEKEND TRIP (though you can meet us at the trailhead the morning of the hike as well). We'll travel to the Schenectady Wintersports Lodge Friday ($20 / night -- private room, full kitchen, fireplace!). CLICK HERE for a link to the location of the clubhouse -- look for the big white house with the letters "SWC" on it. We'll leave for the trailhead about 7 a.m. to enjoy a full day over Vermont's highest trail. We'll plan dinner in Stowe that evening, then make a leisurely return home the next day.

NOTE: If you did not RSVP for lodging by the September 25th deadline and decide you want to go after that, email me; I should be able to add you to the reservation list. As the number of attendees increased, we've been assigned the South Attic hostel-style sleeping area, above the fireplace room. Thus there's a chance many of us may not be able to get a private room; I believe there will be one available for anyone that wants one but, either way, be sure to bring a sleeping bag or comforter. I will collect lodging fees and, if you joined Hiking Mates CHALLENGE, our $5 membership fee when you arrive. - Julie.

Mount Mansfield (elevation 4,393 feet) is the highest mountain in Vermont. From the east its ridge resembles the profile of a human face, and the names of its prominent features reflect this: Adams Apple (4,060'), Chin (4,393', highest point), Nose (4,062') and Forehead (3,940'). For about 2.3 miles (from the Forehead to Adams Apple) the Long Trail is almost constantly above treeline, the only such long stretch of alpine zone in Vermont. The initial climb is difficult; the rest of the trip is easy.


CLICK HERE FOR TRIP PLANNER -- VIEW / PRINT / TAKE WITH YOU (Total miles, 7.2; Total Climb, 3,628' ASL) Please note that I've noticed that the Google Maps tool I use tends to under-represent distances by about 10 percent or so; call this trip nine miles, and you'll be safe.

TRAILHEAD START TIME: 8 A.M., Route 108 trailhead

NOTE: This hike includes a CAR SPOT at the Lake Mansfield Trout Club at the end of Nebraska Valley Road. The route planned will change if we've not enough cars.


"The Forehead," summit of Mt. Mansfield in the warm blue summertime.



An evening picture near Mt. Mansfield, with Lake Champlain visible off in the distance.



WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT.

Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the meetup location to the Schenectady Wintersports Lodge at Waterbury Center, VT; then to the trail car spot at the Lake Mansfield Trout Club on Nebraska Valley Road near Stowe, VT; then to the trailhead at Smuggler's Notch, VT.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items.


ADDITIONAL POLICIES / REQUIREMENTS / ITEMS: None.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

Mt. Mansfield:
http://home.earthlink...
http://www.summitpost...
http://alavigne.net/O...


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.


CLICK HERE FOR A TOPO MAP / HIKE ROUTE.


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back. As with all HM CHALLENGE TRIPS, BE SURE TO READ OUR GUIDELINES.

See you there! Julie.
item.name: GREEN MOUNTAIN SERIES: Early Fall Colors...and Vermont's Highest, Mt. Mansfield
